detailed.reason: Niche partioning tested in different habitats, but no reference to interactions and niche expansion. Spatial overlap measured
Niche of shrub species with conservation angle
Niche modelling (sdm) of shrub species with restoration/conservation angle
Dietary niches of two ungulates evaluated. No mention of expansion of niche due to interactions
Hydrological niche with negative effects of facilitation found
SDMs for a rare cactus with conservation applications. Cattle grazing mentioned, but no positive interactions studied
Phylogenetic niche evaluated for Monitiaceae, evolution of niche. No interactions evaluated
Niche expansion reported via facilitation. Alpine envionments, cushion nurses reported
Facilitation favours a species a early stages. Niche expansion in time (ontogeny)
Shade conditions determined germination of shrub species. Spatial niche
Shrub-grass interactions with facilitation and no facilitation using a model. Niche expansion, space and time
Host-microbe relationships using niche breadth concepts in space and time. Microbes decrease with more host diversity. No plants involved
Community assembly after the removal of Erodium cicutarium. More species returned, no nurse-plant effect reported
Niche over time, Leucocoryne has a low level of niche conservatism. No interactions mentioned, phylogenetic study
Habitat filtering and niche differentiation in a gradient, community analysis based on functional niche via traits
Tree-grass interactions in relation to niche partioning and climate change. Hydrological /depth niche in the soil
Niche partioning tested between two species that have recently diverged. Evolutionary niche, but no facilitation with a shrub or nurse plant directly tested
Thermal niche tested in a single species to develop a model of germination. No interactions tested
Review paper on temporal niche and niche partioning with two study cases based on plant functional types. One of them describes tree-grass interactions
Niche expansion reported with facilitation and biological soil crusts. Stipa as a facilitator
Fundamental niche of shrubs in the Atacama Desert, light and rainfall tested for 6 species. Facilitation discussed as a mechanism of recruitment
Phylogenetic niche expansion as promoted by positive interactions with Stipa as a nurse plant.
Regeneration niche tested for several shrub species in arid environments.
Biotic interactions regulate zonation in a salt marsh. Not desert environment paper
Temporal separation in the deployment of leaves between grasses and trees in an arid savannah for remote sensing purposes. Temporal niche and coexistence
Niche differentiation in tree-grass interaction and its relation with grazing. Greenhouse experiment of competition and clipping
Niche expansion and segregation (partioning) by nurse plants in arid environments.
Niche segregation among species of biological soil crusts in a gradient. Usually negative effects found, no nurse plant facilitation measured
Niche partioning tested between shrubs and grasses in a long term survey. Morphological and functional differences alluded
Niche partioning among 6 annuals in a glasshouse experiment. Positive and negative effects found across life-stages, but no nurse plant effect measured
Niche differentiation in nurse plant - protegee interactions followed along the life cycle with different methods
Phylogenetic niche re-arrangement in the context of nurse plant facilitation and when it turns to competition as the life cycle progresses
Regeneration niche in a tree species, local adaptation and stress gradient hypothesis
Abstract in English, main paper in Chinese
Niche partioning among functional groups: grasses, shrubs and forbs. No facilitation measured. Spatial niche
Shrub-grass interactions with facilitation and competition via multivariate stats. Niche partioning for coexistence
Phylogenetic niche in that species are expected certain interactions according to the phylogenetic distance. Temporal niche at evolutionary scale
Niche partioning between two annual species. No facilitation measured. Spatial niche
Ontogenic (temporal) niche among shrubs change. Ambrosia dumosa tested.
Phylogenetic (evolutionary niche): quaternary plants facilitate tertiary plants via the nurse plant syndrome
Niche differentiation for herbs, when under shrubs they had better perfomance. Spatial safe niches.
Niche expansion by ants mounts. Mounts facilitate more seedlings and species. Spatial niche, but nurse plant measured
Regeneration niche for one shrub in response to rainfall and nurse-plant effects
Niche segregation between exotic and native species, all herbs, no nurse-plant effect measured. Density manipulation
Niche segregation through a glasshouse experiment of competition among 3 plant species. No nurse-plant facilitation tested. Spatial niche partioning
Regeneration niche for several seedlings of shrubs via analysis of biotic and abiotic characteristics. Spatial niche
Regeneration niche of Quercus emoryi, a tree occurring in savanah and ecotones. Temporal niche studied via experiments on amount and timing of rainfall
Not availble, and probably not relevant. Book chapter
Regeneration niche for Nicotiana attenuata, an allelopathic species in relation to fire. No nurse plant effects reported
Spatial niche between shrubs as they change with age via spatial patterns. Spatiotemporal niche.
Hydrological niche between 3 shrubs species and a grass species depending of soil depth. Spatial niche
Niche segregation between two mammal species. Shrubs are mentioned as habitats the species use, but with no explicit niche expansion idea tested. Niche expansion for mammals?
Historical origins of Larrea in North America. No nurse-plant syndrome mentioned or regeneration niche.
